description:
Overview

Grendel-Prime is out of place and out of time. He came to Gotham to retrieve the essence of Grendel -- the skull of Hunter Rose. Now that he has the unholy relic, he must find his way out of Gotham before Batman catches up to him. Plenty of criminals come into his city, but they don't leave until the Dark Knight has delivered justice.
name: Devil's Dance

description:
Descriptions are broken out as such, with each getting its own artwork:

The Thundercats

Tygra

Mandora

Lunatacs

Hachiman

Lion-O

Mumm-Ra

Grune the Destroyer

Thunderkittens / Snarf

Bengali, Lynx-O and Pumyra

Thundertank vs. Fist Pounder

Panthro and Cheetara

Ratar-O

Mutants and Castle Plundarr

Lion-O vs. Mumm-ra

Berserkers
name: Sourcebook

description: BATMAN/GRENDEL pits the relentless determination of the Dark Knight Detective against the diabolic methodology of Hunter Rose, the first incarnation of Matt Wagner's now-classic creation, Grendel. While Bruce Wayne and Hunter Rose play power games in Gotham's high society, Batman finds himself up against a new and vicious foe of uncanny intellect and evil intent, one more than capable of testing the Dark Knight's formidable skills to their limits.
name: Devil's Riddle

description:
The Devil has risen again. Drawing from a deep well of creative talent, Grendel creator and writer Matt Wagner has assembled a breathtaking ensemble of artists to illustrate another round of stories about that most deadly of assassins -- Hunter Rose. From corpulent politicians to opportunistic street thugs, no one is safe from the Devil's watchful eye or his deadly blades. This time out Wagner and company present the many faces of Grendel, showing his first contact with the powerful Ciccone family and painting a compelling portrait of the Devil's sweetly sinister influence over a child's imagination. Collecting five tales drawn by some of comics' most gifted storytellers, this issue launches a miniseries that's sure to please both long-time Grendel readers and newcomers alike.

All stories written by Matt Wagner:

  • The Nasty Li'l Devil - art and lettering by Jill Thompson. This story is written by the insane Stacy Palumbo, and recounts how a demon possessed Hunter Rose and turned him into Grendel.
  • Devil's Assumption - art and lettering by Andy Kuhn. This story tells how Hunter Rose was first hired as Teddy Ciccone's hitman, after killing Ciccone's previous assassin. This story was originally told in a different form in the first issue of Grendel (volume one).
  • Devil Say, Devil Do - art and lettering by Stan Sakai. Grendel hunts down and kills a criminal.
  • Devil Colors - art by Jim Mahfood and lettering by Sean Konot. Grendel's mob organization hires a graffiti artist to spray paint warnings to rival gangs. The painter is caught in the act but saved by Grendel.
  • Devil's Dash - art and lettering by Tom Fowler. Hunter chases a fat, naked, corrupt Congressman through the city.

Overview

This all-new miniseries answers the horrifying question: What if a Grendel became a vampire? In the "Old West" of the future, vampires attack a Grendel clan and a pregnant Grendel is bitten -- causing the "red-eyed" curse to be passed onto the unborn son!
name: Book 1

description:
Overview

Grand. Operatic. Powerful. Matt Wagner's Grendel, a mainstay in the comics arena for decades, has always been a touchstone of eclecticism and excitement. Unfortunately, many of the original stories have been long out of print and are conspicuously absent from the back-issue bins; therefore, in response to readers' demands, Matt Wagner has compiled this Grendel history book. Grendel Cycle begins with an all-new, eight-page primer, written and fully painted by Matt Wagner (Grendel: Devil Quest, Sandman Mystery Theatre), giving new readers a lavish introduction to the Grendel mythos, while refreshing the memories of those who have been there all along. This is followed by an extensive overview of the lost stories and the Grendel concept itself that combines text and new artwork by the original series artists -- Wagner, Arnold Pander (Triple*X), Bernie Mireault (The Jam), Ron Turner, John K. Snyder III (Harlan Ellison's Dream Corridor), Jay Geldhof, Tim Sale (Batman Halloween Special, Deathblow), and Pat McEown (Grendel Tales: Homecoming) -- all returning for the first time to the characters that made them "hot." Special features include a timeline of events and a cover gallery showcasing the cover artwork from the first 50 issues. This book is a must for every Grendel fan. Don't be the last on your block to get the full story.

Overview

Picking up ten years after Grendel Tales: Devils and Deaths, this new series finds the Agram clan embroiled in war. Only these days, it's become a lot harder to tell who's on what side! Since the death of his brother, Goran has developed into the finest warrior in his clan. Unfortunately, he's also the most insubordinate, and his company gets banished to the front lines.

The battlefield holds many surprises for him, as Goran's heart begins to beat not only with fear, but with love as well. Also, amidst the death and chaos, a child is born. Can his young parents escape the war and find happiness at the sea?

Also in this issue: Matt Wagner's fully painted back-up feature, Devil Quest, concludes! In the second installment of "Too Dead to Die," the principal players in this perverse plot reach the end of their mission -- but will Grendel-Prime elude their grasp?
name: Young Devils; Too Dead to Die Part 2

description:
Cover: Ian Gibson (Halo Jones)

description:
This TPB reprints the following issues:

Thor #9

Thor #10

Thor #11

Thor #12

Thor #13

128 pages
name: The Dark Gods

description: This is it! The final battle for the fate of Asgard and the future of mankind. His sacred hammer made whole once more, the God of Thunder with the Lion of Olympus, Hercules, and the unstoppable Destroyer by his side makes an all out attack on the indomitable Dark Gods. The Nine Worlds tremble when gods make war!
name: The Dark Wars, Part Three

description: At last, the secrets of Marnot are revealed! Who is this mysterious benefactor of the Thunder God's? He who can make even the Mistress of the Underworld, Hela, falter in her step?
name: The Work Of Odin

description: What on earth could put the fear of God into the Unstoppable Juggernaut? The mighty Thor intends to find out, but first he'll have to stop the earthly avatar of Cyttorak from destroy downtown Manhattan.
name: The Eighth Day Part 1

description: Thor makes a terrible discovery when he travels to Asgard to seek the council of the gods.
name: As Turneth the Tide

description: Also includes the essay "Mama's Boy Part 3"
name: Rick's Story 9

description:
Overview

This is it: Marvel’s rag-tag group of sci-fi heroes vs. Ultron – in a double-sized finale! The surviving warriors face-off on the battlefield, with the fate of the entire Kree Empire – and perhaps the Earth itself – at stake! Who will fall? Who will rise to become a legend? It’s an extra helping of adventure, humor, drama and eye-candy that IGN.com calls “one of the best event books of the year.”
name: Last Stand

description: The terrible secrets of Saint Sébastien come to light as Abe pushes deeper into the mystery of the island and a legacy of evil that spans the life of humanity itself. Written by Hellboy creator Mike Mignola and featuring the haunting art of Jason Shawn Alexander (Damn Nation, The Secret, The Escapists), Abe Sapien: The Drowning is the story of Hellboy mainstay Abe Sapien's first solo adventure.

Giselle tries to get a nice man. While Genevieve is trying to gain the Guild Master's trust and get them to listen to her. They decide to not tell the public their eternal spirits are gone, but will it last?

As an interesting sidenote, while Thierry is talking to the barkeeper in Jazzrats (a local bar), there are many magical characters from other companies in the background. These include:

  • Bat-Mite
  • Brigid
  • Clea
  • Deadman
  • Dormammu
  • Gandalf (Lord of the Rings)
  • Death of the Endless
  • Diablo
  • Dream of the Endless
  • Dr. Fate
  • Dr. Strange
  • Harry Potter
  • Mr. Mxyzptlk
  • Pied Piper
  • Promethea
  • Raven
  • Scarlet Witch
  • The Seven Dwarfs from Snow White
  • Spectre
  • Zatanna
Giselle is finally getting close to someone when just in time Skitter awakens a magic draining creature. But with the help of the sigil the creature was defeated.

Overview

Originally published in three installments in Dark Horse Presents, this edition collects the blockbuster "prequel" tale written by Randy Stradley and illustrated by Phillip Norwood. This storyline takes place prior to events contained in the Aliens vs. Predator four-issue, full-color series.

Seldom does a creator cause such a sensation with a single body of work, but Bryan Talbot has taken England by storm with his mind-boggling, dimension-spanning The Adventures of Luther Arkwright! But despite the furor overseas, this acclaimed series is still virtually unknown in North America...until now, that is! Dark Horse is proud to present this series in a new, re-lettered, re-formatted edition with new painted covers by Talbot.
name: The Disruption Spiral

description:
Overview

Based on but not adapted from the hit Saturday morning cartoon! Life in Edge City has always been tough for good guy Stanley Ipkiss. But now that Stanley is in possession of the ultra-powerful artifact, the mask, it's. . . well, tougher! There is truth in the old axiom that with great power comes greater trouble! The trouble is everybody wants the mask, including Pretorious, the villainous bad guy, and Walter, the mute monster!
name: Who is That Masked Man

description: Two hundred years ago, Ellen Ripley died in a blazing inferno. But the government has need of her again. So they've rebuilt her. And now she's going to be tested against a hive of Aliens.
Genevieve is getting used to being the master of her guild. But someone tries to take it away from her with blood. And an old friend comes back.

Darrow is back and ready for revenge.  He gives the last of his strength to Animora who escapes from the spirit realm and builds a castle. While this is happening Giselle has a little alone time with Thierry.

Animora starts to destroy each Guild one by one.  Without their eternal spirits they are almost helpless. Giselle wakes up to the eternal spirits yelling at her about what's happening. Giselle than goes to her sister's aid.

Overview

In the year 2032, John Connor and the human resistance forces wage war on the evil super-computer, Skynet. Sensing ultimate defeat, Skynet goes into hiding. Centuries later, it is awakened by stealth Terminators posing as human scientists. Now an even deadlier Skynet is creating invincible Terminator/Alien hybrids! Earth's only chance lies in the hands of a legendary heroine named Ripley and . . . the Predators?! Even this ancient hunter race understands that Skynet threatens all life in the universe. Plus, they love a good fight! Featuring covers by Dwayne Turner (Spawn)!

volume.name: Aliens vs. Predator vs. The Terminator

description:
Overview

The Colonial Marines have captured a live Alien Queen! But when pirate Predators attack the Marines, even the toughest fighters in the galaxy might not be able to hold on to her! Enter Evie, Shel, and Norley, three ordinary, if well-armed, human beings who get caught in the ensuing crossfire. By the time they realize that they're really just extras in the big battle scene, it may be too late to escape from the savagery of either the Aliens or the Predators!

In an opulent city of the future, a mysterious techno-baron controls the fate of the world. But, even with his vast riches and power, the black-clad figure known as Nor cannot stop the hand of death. Or can he? His thoughts are consumed by his latest discovery: a crash-landed Predator ship. It's his belief that Predators hold the key to eternal life. But even if he stands before the answers he seeks, is he willing to go through the Predators' deadly Alien cargo to get it?

Andi Watson and Mel Rubi kick it up a notch--and AvP will never be the same!!! A girl named Charley is doing time on a prison colony. Her boyfriend Elliot has a step-mom in The Company who's willing to get Charley out of stir... for a price. All Charley and Elliott have to do is pull a heist at a rival company's research complex. Simple, until a certain dreadlocked hunter from space frees the research. And you get just one guess as to what that "research" is.
name: 1 of 4

description:
Life's not easy and definitely not for a blood elf. Valeera is trying to help his friends, but things will get complicated while the human assasin is getting closer to Lo'Gosh.

Nevertheless, she was able to stop him, allowing Broll and Lo'Gosh to reach Theramore Keep, where Jaina Proudmoore helped Lo'Gosh to find out his lost identity. Don't miss the shocking relevation.
name: Blood

description:
Overview

Sometimes reeling-in the catch of your life can mean the end of your life. Machiko Noguchi, the last survivor of the colony on Ryushi, is journeying aboard a massive Predator ship when a freshly caught Alien Queen snaps her tethers, destroying all in her path. Unfortunately for her, Machiko is in that path.

This thrilling tale collects the Aliens vs. Predator story serialized in issues #1-#14 of the Dark Horse Insider, with additional interior art by Stradley and Warner and a brain-smashing cover by the spectacular Richard Corben! This special issue serves as the heart-pounding prelude to Aliens vs. Predator: War.

Overview

Catwoman's way off the Hell Planet is set and ready to go, but first she'll have to deal with the villains she's crossed. And she's crossed a lot of villains. Line forms to the left…let's start with the bloodthirsty, claw-wielding, kill-happy Cheetah!
name: The Long Road Home, Part 1

1. The Arena of Doom (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Legion of Super-Villains, Lex Luthor, Brainiac, Lightning Lord, Cosmic King, Saturn Queen, green Kryptonite / written by Jerry Siegel : story continued from last issue)

Superman finds out Brainiac is a machine; also Jimmy, under the control of Superman, is ordered to kill Superman with Kryptonite.

  2. Bizarro-Jimmy, Rock-'N'-Roll Star! (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Bizarro Jimmy, Perry White, Bizarro Perry White, Bizarro World / written by Jerry Siegel)

When Jimmy gets hit on the head, he gets visions that come true.
name: The Arena of Doom

description:
Overview

Ken Connell meets an interdimensional researcher looking for the wearer of the Star Brand. She wants to know more about the man in charge of the most powerful weapon in the galaxy. He wants to know if she’s single. The data raises the question: is Ken worthy to wield the power of the brand--is anyone in the New Universe?

Summary

Arden, a scientist from a parallel dimension who studies the Star Brand, shows up in the New Universe. She runs into Gladiator, a human paranormal who Ken Connell threw into space in Star Brand 8. After talking to him and finding out about Ken, she leaves him there and flies to Earth.

She invisibly spies on Ken for a while, seeing him with his friends Myron and Debbie the Duck. She is not impressed. Ken realizes that someone is following him, however, and manages to grab her and her ship. She falls out and Ken (never one to avoid meeting new ladies) saves her.

She explains that she is from an alternate reality, and talks a little about some of the other Star Brands and universes. It turns out that universes which are pretty "normal" often use comic books to reflect the actual adventures in other, more "unusual" universes.

[Spider-Man, Hulk, Thing, Silver Surfer, Galactus, Mr. Fantastic, and Daredevil appear only as an allusion to these comics.]

The New Universe is a pretty normal one, and it's unusual that he has powers. She has actually read the comic books from another dimension (presumably ours) about him. She also theorizes that the Star Brand power is a multiversal power that runs throughout all existence.

She makes him realize what a weird set of friends he has, and that he hasn't really been living up to his potential. They go dig up some diamonds, hang out on a beach, and sleep together. However, her supervisors from her dimension find out and call her back home.
name: Adventures in the Mulletverse

volume.name: Untold Tales of the New Universe: Star Brand

description:
Mogrooth becomes the next victim of the Tomb of Terror, speared by the Dark God Grimnismal's claws.

description:
Amazing Fantasy #18 Mark Hazzard: Merc

 

Amazing Fantasy #19 Spitfire: Danger Zone

Our story starts today in the mists of bedlam! Mayhem! Sheer terror! Why is everything so fraught with panic, you ask? Well the scene is Chernobyl, in April 1986, and something has just gone horribly, horribly amiss. Technicians on the scene are failing to contain a runaway nuclear reaction, and those who aren't trying to stop a complete meltdown are fleeing for their lives! 
 
Enter Jenny Swensen. Wishing to give the the Mark 1 Man-Amplified Experimental Armor a test run, Doctor Karl Swensen sent his daughter, Jenny to the Soviet Union to observe the complete breakdown of the facility. Things were strained between the two at the moment though, for she insisted on playing way too much Kenny Loggins on the test flight there from the United States.
 
Turning down that 'racket', Jenny decides that she has no choice but to help the people inside the reactor, even though her father wants her to avoid being seen by the locals - that and he's not too sure the suit could even survive the insane amounts of radiation that he was reading, by proxy, through the M.A.X. suit's sensors. Hardly listening to reason, Jenny busts into the place.


Spying a glowing Russian, she asks him what's going on, and after determining that he does in fact speak English, finds out that he is Dimitri Durovich. He goes on to explain that he was a nuclear technician on site, and that while trying to stop the meltdown his body did not fail, but instead began to absorb astounding amounts of nuclear fallout from the reactor nearby.

Not wanting it to spread, Dimitri begs Jenny to douse him in water, and she finds some in an underground branch of the nearby Pripyat River, flowing nearby beneath the reactor. Tunneling in, she drops Dimitri into the water, but even once cooled, he implored her to bury him to save the nearby area from the terrible energies that were roiling within his body. Reluctantly, she does just that.

Flying home soon after, Jenny is scolded anew by Doctor Swensen, who gave Jenny heck for being so reckless... a Spitfire, even. The two then talk about the intended use of the suit, and Jenny then makes her father promise not to let his employer, Mr. Krotze, use the suit for any sort of military applications - to which Dr. Swensen says that would happen 'over his dead body'...  
 

New Avengers #16 Kickers, Inc: Kickin' It in Hell

 

Untold Tales Of The New Universe #1 Star Brand: Adventures in the Multiverse

 

Untold Tales Of The New Universe: D.P.7 #1 DP7: The Dead Plains Seven

TPB of Wolverine #20-#32

Wolverine is lured to Japan by Hydra and the Hand, where he is captured and brainwashed to become the ultimate superhero killer.

description: This is it! The confrontation you wanted to see: Lex Luthor and the Joker go at it in brutal hand-to-hand combat to wrest control of the Hell Planet from each other. Plus, a shocking event that plays directly into Final Crisis! And this is all before things get really bad for our castaways. You don't want to miss this issue!
name: Burning Down the World

description:
The mirror gets darker and the Amazing X-Men more Astonished by the minute as the Age of Apocalypse hits its third quarter! Magneto has dedicated his life to freeing humanity and mutantkind alike, but will Apocalypse now require him to destroy reality to save it! Sides are switched and secrets shown with repercussions ringing from the Savage Land to the Shi'ar Galaxy! Plus: a rare look at how Apocalypse altered the rest of Marvel's mightiest! Doctor Doom and Reed Richards, side-by-side? Matt Murdock and the Kingpin, allies? Gwen Stacy in mourning for Peter Parker? Avengers, Exiles, etc. in the original alternate X-saga!

Contents

This TPB reprints the following issues: Factor X #3, Gambit and the X-Ternals #3, Generation Next #2, Generation Next #3, The Amazing X-Men #3, The Astonishing X-Men #2, The Astonishing X-Men #3, The Astonishing X-Men #4, Weapon X #3, X-Calibre #2, X-Calibre (1995) #3, X-Man (1995) #2, X-Man (1995) #3, and X-Universe (1995) #1.

360 pages
name: Book 3

volume.name: X-Men: Age of Apocalypse: The Complete Epic

description:
Overview

Stanley Ipkiss is a man who leads a life of danger -- not as a secret-agent man, but as The Mask! However, notorious international spy Gardenia Thorn has mistaken Stanley for Secret Agent 911 in "Shaken and Stirred," a send up of Ian Fleming's James Bond. When Stanley's green mask has worked its magic on Gardenia, she's going to wish she'd only had Q's weapons to deal with!

Ninth Birthday prog, with a raft of new stories including Sooner or Later, Judge Anderson and Bad City Blue.

Cover: Brett Ewins (Judge Anderson)

  • Sooner or Later (part 1) (Peter Milligan - Brendan McCarthy and Tony 'Riot' Wright)
  • 2000AD Star Pin-Up - Tharg the Mighty (art: Ian Gibson)
  • Judge Anderson - The Possessed (part 1) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Brett Ewins)
  • Judge Dredd - It Pays to be Mental (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Ian Gibson)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 18) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Bad City Blue (part 1) (Alan Grant - Robin Smith)
name: Prog 468

description:
Overview

Dober-Man is back! He's coming home, he's done his time, and now he's looking to make good with society by fighting crime -- as The Mask's kid sidekick! But crime fighting isn't all glamour and glitz. It's serious business! And it's serious trouble when Walter breaks out of the big house and comes looking for our green-faced galahad! It's shaping up to be a dog-day afternoon for our dynamic duo, and something tells me Dober-Man won't be back for next issue!

After last weeks opening episode, Sooner or Later moves to the backcover for the rest of its single page run. Johnny Alpha is also back this prog, on the hunt for Max Bubba, the mutant who killed his partner, Wulf Sternhammer.

Cover: Carlos Ezquerra (Strontium Dog)

  • Judge Anderson - The Possessed (part 2) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Brett Ewins)
  • Bad City Blue (part 2) (Alan Grant - Robin Smith)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 19) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Strontium Dog - Rage (part 1) (Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - Alien Aid (Grant Morrison - John Stokes)
  • Judge Dredd - Rumours Can Kill (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Ian Gibson)
  • Sooner or Later (part 2) (Peter Milligan - Brendan McCarthy and Tony 'Riot' Wright)
name: Prog 469

description:
Overview

It's Christmas time for The Mask! Stanley's coworker Charlie Schumacher is a total grinch, and when he gets ahold of the mask, it transforms him into $anta Ma$k, a self-serving Saint Nick. Now everybody's dreaming of a green Christmas, and it's a real nightmare -- until the real Santa shows up to help Stanley straighten out the holiday!

Overview

Bigger than the Menendez brothers! More controversial than O.J.! It's the trial of the millennium -- the trial of The Mask! Courtroom high jinks ensue when Kellaway indicts that merry prankster, The Mask, in this wacky spoof of America's obsession with the judicial system!

Cover: Robin Smith (Bad City Blue)

  • Judge Anderson - The Possessed (part 3) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Brett Ewins)

name: Prog 475

description:
The Uncanny X-Men adventures with the Marvel Mutant Massacre begins with the trial of Magneto! Rachel Summers becomes Phoenix and the Brotherhood becomes Freedom Force! Lady Deathstrike becomes a cyborg, Moonstar a Valkyrie, Colossus a killer, and Psylocke an X-Man! And Sabretooth first set his clawed foot into the X-Universe alongside his fellow Marauders! Guest-starring the original X-Factor, Power Pack and Thor! Gods, Morlocks, talking frogs and more!

This book reprints the following issues:

Power Pack #27

The New Mutants #46

The New Mutants Special Edition #1

The Uncanny X-Men Annual 09

The Uncanny X-Men # 199-213

Thor # 373-374

X-Factor # 9-11

656 pages
name: Volume 6

description: Stealth, subtlety, and subterfuge are the name of the game in this issue of The Adventures of Luther Arkwright. Pursued across all parallels by the sinister Disrupters, Arkwright goes in search of the Firefrost crystal- an artifact whose purpose and history can only be deciphered by Arkwright and his psychic gifts- but will the effort mean his death?
name: The Firefrost Principle

description: Luther Arkwright's struggle against the Disruptors takes him to a divergent parallel where he must defend King Charles against the motorcycle troops of the Lord Protector of Westminster Abbey! It's the first real battle of the war in "Black Tuesday,"!
name: Black Tuesday

description:
A rare cover for one of Tharg's Future Shocks.

Cover: Anthony Jozwiak (Tharg's Future Shocks)

  • The Ballad of Halo Jones - book three (part 11) (Alan Moore - Ian Gibson)
  • 2000AD Star Pin-Up - Judge Dredd (Cliff Robinson)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - The Armageddon Game (Peter Milligan - Anthony Jozwiak)
  • Judge Dredd - The Falucci Tape (part 2) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Cam Kennedy)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 12) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Strontium Dog - Max Bubba (part 18) (Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
name: Prog 462

description: Following his bloody coup, the Lord Protector of Westminister Abbey consolidates his rule of the British Empire - thus furthering the diabolical plot of the Disruptors to take over the multiverse! Meanwhile, Arkwright lies in a coma, suffering from the near-fatal wound he received defending Britain's rightful King.
name: The Theatre of Cruelty

description:
To judge the success of the adventure game aspect of the last Slaine story, there's a questionnaire with this issue. 2000AD never ran a story/game like this again. There's your answer.

Cover: Cam Kennedy (Judge Dredd)

  • The Ballad of Halo Jones - book three (part 12) (Alan Moore - Ian Gibson)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 13) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - Hotel Harry Felix! (Grant Morrison - Geoff Senior)
  • Judge Dredd - The Falucci Tape (part 3 - final part) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Cam Kennedy)
  • Slaine - Tomb of Terror (questionnaire)
  • Strontium Dog - Max Bubba (part 19) (Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
name: Prog 463

description: In this issue titled "The Doors of Perception," Arkwright falls into the hands of his enemies and is brutally tortured to death... and transformed!
name: The Doors of Perception

description: In this issue, titled "Destiny's Angel," the effects of Firefrost are accelerating and Luther must halt it or lose Rose forever. Meanwhile, Anne leads her army against the forces of Cromwell as she goes into labor with Luther's twins.
name: Destiny's Angel

description: "The Battle of London" finds Arkwright and Cromwell locking wills in a final psychic battle as Anne leads her army against Cromwell's forces after giving birth to Luther's twins! Parallels collide as this compelling, award-winning series nears its final chapter.
name: The Battle of London

description: This is it! The exciting conclusion to Bryan Talbot's stunning, award-winning masterwork! After so many battles, in so many dimensions, will Arkwright be able to stop the Disruptors in time? More importantly, will he stop them in the right time?!
name: The Hand of God

description:
Cover: Brett Ewins (Judge Dredd)

  • The Ballad of Halo Jones - book three (part 13) (Alan Moore - Ian Gibson)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - Oh What a Lovely War (Oleh Stepaniuk - John Stokes)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 14) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Judge Dredd - Gribligs (part 1) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Barry Kitson)
  • Strontium Dog - Max Bubba (part 20) (Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
  • 2000AD Star Sun-Up - The Dictators of Zragula (art: Eric Bradbury)
name: Prog 464

description:
Overview

Stanley Ipkiss is knee-deep in trouble -- literally! Having thrown away the mask, Stanley finds himself stuck in cement, about to be crushed by the mute man-mountain known as Walter! Does our hero turned zero have any hope?
name: Big Mask Attack!

description:
Wulf Sternhammer meets his maker in the final part of the current Strontium Dog story...

Cover: Massimo Belardinelli (Ace Trucking Co.)

  • The Ballad of Halo Jones - book three (part 14) (Alan Moore - Ian Gibson)
  • Strontium Dog - Max Bubba (part 21 - final part) (Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 15) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - Seconds Out! (Oleh Stepaniuk - Jeff Anderson)
  • Judge Dredd - Gribligs (part 2 - final part) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Barry Kitson)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - Suds' Law! (Oleh Stepaniuk - Kim Raymond)
  • Poster - The New Masters - Cliff Robinson (art: Cliff Robinson)
name: Prog 465

description: Milo has been abducted by the diabolical dognapper known as DOBER-MAN! Stanley has no choice but to call on the help of the wackiest superhero of our time, The Mask. But will he be ready when the sweet pooch is transformed into The Mask's deadliest adversary?
name: It's A Dog's Life

description:
Overview

Beware the beautiful bombshell -- she's armed with a ballistic kiss that'll literally blow you off your feet! She's blonde, she's bad, and she's just bursting out all over! And if The Mask can't see past her drop-dead mug, this dreamboat will leave dock with half the loot in Edge City!

Overview

Stanley and Milo take a vacation during the season . . . the hurricane season, that is! Their North Carolina dream vacation goes bust when Hurricane Diana comes rolling in, carrying with it a wave of destruction that includes Stanley's old foes Pretorious and Walter! But the fun doesn't stop there, as the Carolina coast gets a visitation from beyond the grave in Adventures of The Mask #5!
name: A Head For Trouble

description:
Overview

Since he first appeared in Edge City, The Mask has been nothing but trouble for Lt. Kellaway! What's a poor cop to do against the green guy's awe-inspiring power? Suit up in state-of-the-art Electronocop armor, that's what! Will The Mask survive this pyrotechnic, frenetic attack? Will Edge City? Tune in to this fun-filled festival of four-color frolic and find out!
name: I Wear The Body Electronic

description:
Final ever Halo Jones episode this prog.

Cover: Ian Gibson (Halo Jones)

  • The Ballad of Halo Jones - book three (part 15 - final part) (Alan Moore - Ian Gibson)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - Biological Warfare (Oleh Stepaniuk - John Stokes)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 16) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)

name: Prog 466

description:
Cover: Cam Kennedy (Judge Dredd)

  • Strontium Dog - Smiley's World (part 2 - final part) (Alan Grant - Carlos Ezquerra)
  • Tharg the Mighty - Supersub! (TMO - Eric Bradbury)
  • Ace Trucking Co. - The Doppelgarp (part 17) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Judge Dredd - The Big Sleep (part 2 - final part) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Cam Kennedy)

  • Poster - The New Masters - Carlos Ezquerra (art: Carlos Ezquerra)
name: Prog 467

description: Arkwright's struggle with the malevolent Disruptors continues across the many facets of the multi-verse - each similar to the Earth we know, but each with a subtle difference! Will Arkwright's formidable psychic gifts be enough to tip the scales in his favor, or is death al that awaits the multi-verse's last hope?
name: The Treaty of St. Petersburg

description:
Overview

The Mask will go anywhere, do anything, if it means a little fun! Next stop -- the TV Tube awards ceremony! But our green friend isn't winning any awards, or any friends, for that matter! All he is getting is the beating of his life from his oddest foe yet, the Couch Potato! Even with all his tricks, how does The Mask defeat someone who can control his every move?

Overview

There's no doubt that the mask can transform anyone into the living embodiment of cartoon chaos! But one little fella takes the cake above all others . . . a little fella who's got to wear the mask to get his pal Stanley out of trouble . . . a little fella known only as . . . Milo! Everyone's favorite pooch has got the empowering green artifact, and he'll lay all of Edge City to waste to save Stanley from total annihilation!

Cover: Ian Gibson (Judge Dredd)

description:
Overview

As the Outsiders perform a search-and-rescue mission for missing member Metamorpho, Batman and his team stumble into a terrifying conspiracy that begins at the edge of outer space…and goes far beyond!
name: Ghost Star
